summary: HIV/AIDS is a global pandemic.[1] As of 2017, approximately 36.9million people are living with HIV globally.[2] In 2018, approximately 43% are women.[2] There were about 940,000 deaths from AIDS in 2017.[2]  The 2015 Global Burden of Disease Study, in a report published in The Lancet, estimated that the global incidence of HIV infection peaked in 1997 at 3.3 million per year. Global incidence fell rapidly from 1997 to 2005, to about 2.6 million per year, but remained stable from 2005 to 2015.[3]
question: How many people die from AIDs each year?
label: about 940,000
